column1: 在世代繁衍過程中，住在非洲陽光飽和緯度地區的人類適應成為有較多黑色素生產量，及較多的真黑素，使皮膚呈現較深色。
column2: Over the course of generations, humans living at the Sun-saturated latitudes in Africa adapted to have a higher melanin production threshold and more eumelanin, giving skin a darker tone.

column1: 當皮膚暴露於紫外線下，會觸發特殊的感光受體 ─ 稱為「視紫質」，它會刺激黑色素的產生， 以免細胞遭受破壞。
column2: When it's exposed to UV light, that triggers special light-sensitive receptors called rhodopsin, which stimulate the production of melanin to shield cells from damage.

column1: 這是一個問題， 因為雖然紫外線會損傷皮膚，但它也帶來同等重要的好處。
column2: This was a problem because although UV light can damage skin, it also has an important parallel benefit.

column1: 紫外線可幫助我們身體產生維生素D，一種強化骨骼並讓我們吸收重要礦物質的成分，如鈣、鐵、鎂、磷酸鹽和鋅。
column2: UV helps our bodies produce vitamin D, an ingredient that strengthens bones and lets us absorb vital minerals, like calcium, iron, magnesium, phosphate, and zinc.

column1: 經過數代的物竸天擇，在那些地區的人膚色逐漸變淡。
column2: Over many generations of selection, skin color in those regions gradually lightened.

column1: 對那些能有效阻擋所有陽光的皮膚黝黑者而言，當他們到北方時，維生素D缺乏會造成嚴重的威脅。
column2: For humans whose dark skin effectively blocked whatever sunlight there was, vitamin D deficiency would have posed a serious threat in the north.

column1: 其核心是「黑色素」，賦予皮膚與頭髮顏色的色素。
column2: It all centers around melanin, the pigment that gives skin and hair its color.
